archimate:Requirement.name: Scanning of code URLs and templates
archimate:Requirement.documentation:
As a TEMA security resource I need to ensure that the Vulnerability Scanning service supports scanning of offline templates to uncover vulnerabilities and malicious code. In a regular virtualized environment deployments rely on templates for virtual machines.
As a TEMA security resource I need to ensure that the services support collection of pipeline specific log data that can be used as input to developers as a way of feedback and troubleshooting
As a TEMA security resource I need to ensure that the VA service supports scanning of malicious code and URL insertions, and the scanned data can be used in security audits and patch management. In a regular Development Pipeline code is stored in a Repository and the code is also checked in to Version Control. A big part of development relies on existing code from different communities.
As a TEMA security resource I need to ensure that the Vulnerability Scan Service supports code scanning to uncover plain-text credentials. During testing in a regular development environment developers often use plain-text passwords directly in code snippets. There will be clear guidelines prohibiting this.
As a TEMA security resource I need to ensure that the Vulnerability Scan service has capabilities to handle security issues in Realtime and/or the Security Management Service must support Realtime scanning and reporting. Scan data will be used during security audits and patch management.
